episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Finding and Funding Deals that Make Sense
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Dumb deals are easy to find. But your lender will usually stop it from happening. Sometimes not. And if you're investing with cash, it's ALL on you. So whether you're an active or aspiring individual investor ... or you're making a lot of money in your day job and need a place to invest it ... or if you're a syndicator investing other people's money ... YOU need to know how to vet both the deal AND the team. Listen in as we talk with a successful seasoned investor about how he uses macro and local factors to find and fund deals that make sense. The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed. Subscribe to our free newsletter at RealEstateGuysRadio.com Please rate us on iTunes and Like us on Facebook. Thanks!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Real Estate Cycles - Preparing to Thrive in the Next Downturn
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: The ebb and flow of real estate cycles may be tame compared to stock, bonds and commodities... but there are still ups and downs real estate investors have to prepare for. Real estate has been in a great upward swing the last 8 years... and some investors in the game today didn't go through the 2008 financial crisis. Too bad because there were LOTS of lessons for those who did. In this episode, we interview a 2008 survivor about how YOU can thrive through an economic downturn. The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed. Subscribe to our free newsletter at RealEstateGuysRadio.com Please rate us on iTunes and Like us on Facebook. Thanks!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Peak Portfolio Management
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Real estate markets and product classes go through cycles of peaks and valleys. Whether you’re a vet or just beginning, it's smart pay attention to where you're at in a cycle ... and how you can optimize cycles to work for you and not against you. In this episode show, we talk with super-successful multi-family investor and Rich Dad advisor, Ken McElroy. Ken's a savvy investor who's thrived through severe market cycles. So tune in as we reveal tips about what smart investors focus on when markets appear to be peaking ... and how to set yourself up for success even if things slow down. The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed. episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Robert Kiyosaki joins us for a candid discussion on why the rich get richer... and how you can too. For 20 years, Kiyosaki's groundbreaking book Rich Dad Poor Dad has shattered both sales records and financial paradigms. Kiyosaki inspires many and confounds some with his sometimes controversial ideas and candid delivery. In this interview, we talk Donald Trump, global financial woes, why the rich get richer, and how anyone with the courage to act can succeed in almost any economic environment. episodes.summary: Like love and driving, investing involves risk. But there's a big difference between being reckless and taking calculated risks. In this episode, we discuss some of the many risks real estate investors face ... and strategies for mitigating those risks and maximizing the probabilities of success. episodes.title: Tribes - Why and How to Find or Build Yours
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Real estate investing is TEAM activity. All but the most extreme lone wolf operators need positive interactions with other people. And there's no need to reinvent the wheel or trek though your investing life alone! It's not just about getting things done. It's about staying inspired, empowered and energized.  Plus, there's huge value in tribal knowledge. People learn faster in packs. So tribes matter. Most people fall into theirs by default. We think you may want to be more strategic. But how? In this episode of The Real Estate Guys radio show, we talk about the why and how of tribes. The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.

episodes.title: Stupid Investor Tricks
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Investing results are the product of external circumstances and how you respond. Because you can't control external events, it's important to make good decisions and follow through with effective action. But sometimes people just do stupid things. The good news is there are great lessons in stupidity. Of course, those lessons cost more when we're the stupid ones! In this episode, we take a look at a collection of stupid things we've seen, read about ... and yes, done ourselves. So listen in as we learn from Stupid Investor Tricks. episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Dreaming of real estate riches is one thing. Setting quantifiable goals and creating actionable plans is another. But like anything else, knowing something needs to be done is only the beginning. Knowing HOW to get it done is essential. And once you have a plan, DOING it is what matters. So if you have big dreams and a lot of drive, but aren't sure how to put it all together, tune in to this episode as we dig deep into real estate goal setting ... and how to create a new plan for a brand new year! episodes.title: Safe Haven Investing with Real Estate
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: In good times and bad, properly structured income producing real estate has proven itself to be among the safest long term investments in history. Before there were stock markets, mutual funds... or even a United States or European Union... the wealthy of the world made and kept their wealth safe with real estate. So in a world of exploding debt and populist pushback on global elites... when Central Banks are printing money and manipulating markets for good cause or not... does real estate have a role in a safe haven portfolio? Tune in and find out in this episode of The Real Estate Guys Radio Show! The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.

episodes.title: Finding Great Properties in Strong Markets
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Finding great deals in strong markets can be more challenging when real estate is doing The lazy way out is to move into lesser markets where there's less competition. This can be dangerous because a weak market is often more powerful than a great deal on an individual property. It's easier for a strong market to pull up a weak property than it is for a strong property to stand up against a weak market.  So before you give up on cash flowing in prime markets, listen to this episode. We visit with a seasoned investor in one of the best real estate markets in the U.S. - and discover how he's finding great cash flowing properties... in spite of the market's strength. The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed. Subscribe to our free newsletter! episodes.title: Real Estate Retirement Account Riches
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Retirement accounts add up to a nearly $8 TRILLION war chest investors can use to secure their financial future. Most is invested in volatile, manipulated paper asset markets like stock and bonds. And while many real estate investors are aware self-directed retirement accounts can be used to buy, finance or option real estate... MOST paper asset investors do NOT. Whether you're among the few, the proud, the informed... or the idea of unleasing the power of your retirement money into real estate is an exciting new concept... there are some recent changes you should know about. In this episode, we sit down with one of our favorite self-directed IRA gurus for all the wealth-building details. So listen in and learn how YOU can tap into this nearly $8 trillion treasure chest. episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Millennials will be bigger than the baby boomers. Are you ready? Are they? They'll be your tenants, employees, vendors... and in some cases, your investors and advisors. And some day, they'll be running the show. So while some say Millennials are a lazy, entitled collection of basement dwellers, we think they might just be the next great hope for the world. And if we're right, then one of the best investments you'll ever make just might be believing in the next generation... and helping them fulfill their potential. episodes.title: Unleashing the Power of Emotional Capital
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Two great guests talk about the importance of developing and managing emotional capital. Many an investor has succumbed to either greed or fear...taking undue risk or failing to act on opportunity. That usually doesn't end well. Yes it's true. We worry too much about having our feelings hurt, but it's often our feelings which can hurt us! Hot markets can make you arrogant and sloppy. Not good. Crazy markets can make you nervous...causing hesitation in the face of opportunity. But remember: there's HUGE opportunity in volatile times when you can make you emotions serve you...and not vice versa. Can YOU take decisive action in uncertain times? Our guests say that's one of the secrets of superior wealth building. So listen is as we talk with two brilliant, very successful, and emotionally rich guests about the value of emotional capital. The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.

episodes.title: Preparing for the Next Crash - Strategies for Weathering a Storm
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: If you caught the real estate investing bug after 2008, you've been riding a fun wave of rising rents and growing equity.  Was 2008 a one-and-done anomaly?  Or are vicious ups and downs a part of the new normal?  And is another crash coming?  No one knows.  But it's probably a good idea to be prepared.  In this episode, we'll take a look at some of the strategies you can use to prepare your portfolio to weather stormy economic seas.  Just in case. episodes.title: The New Case for Gold with James Rickards
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Special guest James Rickards joins us to talk about the amazing happenings in global economics...the role gold is likely to play...and how it affects investors of all types...real estate and otherwise.
Remember, gold was the center of global finance for most of human history.  It's only been in the last 50 years that gold has been derided by some as a "barbarous relic".
But what if gold is making a comeback?  What if paper (and digital) money is in trouble?  And what is gold saying about the financial health of the United States and the future of the U.S. dollar?
Tune in and find out as we talk the new case for gold with James Rickards!

episodes.title: Predictions for the New Year - Bullish, Bearish or Boring
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
LOTS of uncertainty heading into 2016...
The stock market is off to its worst start since the Great Depression. Oil is tanking. China's in a slump. Retail holiday sales were soft.
Yet the U.S. government reports a strong jobs market. Rents have been rising. Mortgage rates remain low in spite of the Fed's decision to bump up the federal funds rate in December.
All this against the backdrop of one of the most unusual election years in U.S. history.
In this episode, we take a look into the crystal balls of a variety of pundits and industry observers...and toss in our two cents...as we try to decide if 2016 will be a bullish, bearish or boring year for real estate investors.
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed. Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! Visit www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.title: Ask The Guys - Getting Started, Paying Off Debt, and Selling to Your Tenant
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
How to get started investing is one of the most common questions we're asked. So no surprise it comes up again in this edition of Ask The Guys.
Of course, the answer depends on where you're at, where you want to go, what you have to work with, and what's happening in the marketplace at the time. So even though the question repeats, the answer is seldom the same.
Another popular question is about the use of debt. With interest rates at record lows, but growing concerns over student and consumer debt, there's a debate about whether it's a good idea to pay off debt BEFORE you start investing...or if it makes sense to get started anyway. We’ll tell you what we think.
We also address the question of when and how to consider selling your investment property to your current tenant.
And lots more... so listen in as listeners Ask The Guys!

episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Relationships are one of the most valuable assets a real estate investor has.
In our careers, we're thankful for the many great ones we have. We KNOW they're great because we've had some real bad ones to compare them to.
In this Thanksgiving edition of The Real Estate Guys radio show, we reflect back on how some of the many people we've known and worked with conducted themselves. Some were (and are) awesome. Others…not so much.
Through all of it, we learned there are characteristics and clues to watch for - good and bad. And learning the difference and responding accordingly can make or save you a lot of heartache...and money.
So listen in and learn how to recognize a relationship you should treasure or a turkey you should avoid.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Bulls, Bears and a Broader Perspective from Three Big Brains
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Broadcasting from the 41st annual New Orleans Investment Conference, we sit down to chat with Mark Skousen, Peter Schiff and Brien Lundin.
Mark Skousen has been named one of the top 20 living economists. He's been writing a successful stock investing newsletter for nearly four decades. And he's a bull.
Peter Schiff is a money manager, a multi-time best-selling author, and he famously warned a skeptical world about the 2008 financial crisis...in 2006. He says nothing's fundamentally fixed. In fact, Peter says the next crash will be even bigger than the last one. Some say he’s a bear.
Brien Lundin is an expert in gold. He's the producer of the New Orleans Investment Conference and the publisher of a very popular newsletter on precious metal investing. Gold is an alternative to dollars as a store of liquid value. And the gold helps us understand what’s happening with the dollar. So even those you don’t hold gold can benefit from watching it.
None of these guys are real estate investors. So they don't look at the world with a real estate bias. We like to visit with them because they help us discover blind spots we might have when we look at real estate.
After four days in New Orleans, all our brain cells were fired up. So listen in as we talk about interest rates, the dollar, real estate, gold and what the future holds.
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed. Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! Visit www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.summary:
Inspections are a very important part of real estate investing. Having trained experts objectively evaluate the condition of all components of a property help prevent unexpected, unpleasant and expensive surprises. Inspections also provide leverage when margins and negotiations are tight.

Listen in and learn how inspections help you discover questions you didn't even know to ask!

episodes.title: Fed or Foe - Two Valid Views on the Federal Reserve
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Former Federal Reserve chair Ben Bernanke is taking a victory lap and promoting his new book, The Courage to Act. Meanwhile, ex- Congressman and multi-time Presidential candidate Ron Paul is a well-known long-time critic of the Fed.
One thing's for sure - The Fed is the most powerful financial force on the planet. Their decisions affect interest rates, economic activity, investment activity and the price of every product, commodity or service worldwide. Paper asset investors hang on every word the Fed utters...and real estate investors should pay close attention too.
Both Ben Bernanke and Ron Paul appeared at separate events in separate cities within days of each other. So The Real Estate Guys decided to split up and cover both. Robert was in Dallas to hear Ron Paul. Russ headed to San Francisco is listen to Ben Bernanke.
In this episode we compare notes and reflect on what we heard and how it affects real estate investors. Listen in and decide for yourself - is the Fed a friend….or foe?
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed. Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! Visit www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.summary: Equity happens.  But sometimes on the road to real estate riches, bad stuff happens too.In our annual "reality check" episode, we visit with several real life real estate investors who had things go horribly wrong and lived to talk...and laugh...about it.Of course, if you're going to have a bad experience it can be therapeutic to revisit it and look for the lesson.  After all, you paid full price for it.  And even better when you can get a great lesson that someone else paid for.So listen in as we talk trouble in this episode of Halloween Horror Stories!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Going Global for Privacy, Asset Protection and Tax Savings
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Most people invest in real estate for building wealth to enjoy then pass on to their family. But because of poor or little planning, some investors lose huge chunks of their assets to lawsuits and taxation.
So in an age of hackers, surveillance and money hungry governments, it's never been more important to structure your holdings for maximum privacy, protection and tax mitigation.
It used to be good enough to set up a simple local structure. More sophisticated investors and businesses then began to use interstate structures.
Today, it's becoming more common for investors to use global strategies to build and protect wealth, minimize taxes and maximize privacy. Because the easier it is for a predator to find your wealth and make a claim on it, the more likely you are to come under attack.
In this epsiode we welcome back internationl asset protection attorney Joel Nagel who shares his strategies for going global to protect wealth and pass more if it on when the time comes.
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed. Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! Visit www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.title: In Search of Yield - Escape from Wall Street with Private Placements
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Big banks and Wall Street have once again been accused of manipulating a major market.  As if the LIBOR scandal wasn't bad enough, the latest allegations of Treasury market shenanigans highlight the dangers of little fish swimming with big sharks.
But with banks paying virtually nothing on savings, and high yielding residential real estate getting harder to find...where's an investor to go for higher yields and real assets?
In this episode, attorney Mauricio Rauld talks with us about the growing popularity of private placements.  These are non-publicly traded investments where a sponsor organizes a group of private investors to purchase a single property or a portfolio of properties.
These are deals typically too big for Mom & Pop investors to do, so you're not competing for profits with Johnny-come-lately novices who bid prices up.  But they're also too small for the big institutions to bother with, so there's often a "sweet spot" with private placements where deals still make sense...even in a hot market.
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! Visit www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.summary:

In a world where working class people are getting poorer in terms of real wages, finding ways to derive rental income from the affluent is something every real estate investor should be considering.

episodes.summary:

In this first episode in our series on finding yield, we go WAY outside of box of little green houses and red hotels. 
We talk to a lawyer who helps international clients research and acquire income producing farmland in Uruguay.  It's easier than you think!
Then we visit with the Premier of the tiny Caribbean island nation of Nevis. Like Uruguay, they are very welcoming of foreign investors.  But their opportunities involve resort properties suitable for vacation rentals.
And we don't want to leave the Eastern hemisphere out of the conversation, we visit with an asset manager about the amazing opportunities in the Southeast Asian country of Myanmar (formerly Burma),..where investors can get investment insurance for up to 270 percent of investment...guaranteed by the U.S. government!
So listen in and discover a much bigger world of real estate investment opportunity!

episodes.summary:

episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Of all markets, Dallas led the U.S. out of the Great Recession.  Great job growth, outstanding cash flows, high rental demand and lots of inventory.
Pre-recession, Dallas was a ho-hum appreciation market.  Post-recession, Dallas has been an equity generating machine.
Funny how that works.  Solid fundamentals will almost always lead to a solid trend. 
And it didn't take long for Wall Street hedge funds and international investors to get in on the action and change the dynamics in the market.
So where's the Dallas investment real estate market today?  To find out, we descend on Dallas to discuss the details with two of our boots on the ground team.

episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Technology, laws and international politics are all changing how money moves into and around markets.
In the last quarter of the 20th century, creative financing largely consisted of assumable loans, owner carry backs and equity sharing.
Fourteen years into the new millennium, crowdfunding, peer-to-peer lending, citizenship programs and growing wealth in emerging countries are opening up a whole new world of opportunity for real estate investors.
In this episode, we visit with a New York immigration attorney to take a closer look at the United States' EB5 program and how real estate investors can tap into worldwide wealth to get deals funded.

episodes.title: Tracking Trends in Commercial Real Estate and the Broader Economy
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Commercial real estate can be a leading indicator of economic trends.  When businesses are optimistic, they lease space to house more employees and accommodate anticipated growth.  Both are good for landlords.
Likewise, when businesses are pessimistic, they don't add space, renew leases or accept rental increases...and they don't hire.  That's not good for landlords.
And when things are REALLY bad, businesses just stop paying or move their operations to more affordable, friendlier jurisdictions if they can find them.  This can be good or bad for landlords depending on which side of the migration you're on.
In this episode we take a look at commercial real estate trends with one of the biggest brains in the business, Dr. David Lynn.  David has PhD from the London School of Economics, is a prolific author on real estate related topics, and has served as the Chief Investment Strategist for more than one multi-billion dollar real estate investment funds.
Speaking of fund managers, we also check in with returning guest Frank Holmes of U.S. Global Investors.  Frank's not a real estate guy, but as the investment strategist for a top performing fund family, Frank pays close attention to the macro trends which affect ALL investors - real estate or otherwise.
So listen in as we take the pulse of the broader economy with David Lynn and Frank Holmes!
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! Visit www.realestateguysradio.com.

The great news for real estate investors is there are great properties and markets located outside your primary area and country. And there are lots of reasons to consider developing an international economic plan.

episodes.title: The One Skill That Solves Every Problem
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
If there were only ONE skill you could have...the one that would help you get everything you want or need out of life...what would it be?
Our good friend and mega-successful entrepreneur Ken McElroy says, "Sales solves every problem."
Now he was talking about revenue being the answer to cash flow problems.
But it got us thinking.  And his statement is far bigger than merely making money.
After all, if you've ever tried to win the heart of that special guy or gal, or convince your headstrong child to make better choices in life, or simply want to win the debate about where to go on vacation this year...you've been using sales skills.
And if you aren't getting your way more often than not, perhaps your sales skills need some attention.
As real estate investors, we're constantly negotiating with buyers and seller, vendors and lenders, tenants and neighbors, and the list goes on and on and on.
Even if you delegate to others, you still have to recruit and lead them.  And that comes back to sales skills.
So tune in and see if you agree with us that sales is the one skill that solves every problem.

Less than a year ago the rules for soliciting investors were relaxed...allowing real estate entrepreneurs to be much more aggressive in seeking capital.

episodes.title: Property Rights - The Foundation of Prosperity
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
The ability to own private property is the foundation for building wealth with real estate...or anything else for that matter.
But what is “ownership” without control?  And what happens when society’s needs and desires slam up against individual rights?
While most people agree an individual homeowner should probably be restricted from building a nuclear waste dump in their backyard in deference to the greater good of the community…should society be able to dictate how much rent landlords should be allowed to charge or who they rent to?
It’s a touchy subject and conflicts occur all the time.  That’s where the lawyers get involved.
So if you’re going to be a property owner, it’s a good idea to understand the basics of property rights.  
In this episode we talk to a couple of lawyers who are involved in conflicts with government over issues of individual rights versus societal controls…some of which are over rights you might not even know exist.
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! Visit www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.summary: The tax inversion debate has some saying that profits and corporate responsibility are on opposite ends of the spectrum.  But our guest Harris Rosen disagrees.  Harris started with next to nothing and today owns more hotel rooms in Orlando than anyone else except a little outfit called Disney.  And he’s 100% debt free!But as great as all that is, Harris Rosen has proven nice guys don’t have to finish last.  In fact, Harris makes the argument taking care of your employees (he calls them family members) is one of the most important secrets to success.  So whether you’re running a few rental houses, a collection of apartments, or thousands of hotel rooms in a popular resort destination, Harris Rosen’s principled approach can help you do well...while doing good.Listen in and prepare to be inspired!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! episodes.title: Ask The Guys - The Next Bubble, Green Renters and Global Warming
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Real estate investing isn't as simple as it used to be.  At least not judging by the kinds of questions we're getting from our listeners!In this episode, we take take on questions about the impact of global warming on real estate market selection, whether tenants will pay more for environmentally friendly homes, and whether or not the raging bull in stocks and real estate is real...or is there another big bubble getting ready to implode?  And that's just to name a few!So sit down, buckle up, and hold on as we blast off into another exciting episode of Ask The Guys...on The Real Estate Guys™ Radio Show.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! Visit www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.summary: Markets usually put out a vibe when they're heating up.  Do you know how to pick up on the signals?In this episode, we talk about the signs a market is getting hot.  And how to tell the difference between a tease and one that's ready to deliver on the promise.To make the point, we invite back a good friend of the program, and break down one of the sexiest real estate markets in the world.So get ready to get all worked up during this episode of The Real Estate Guys™ radio show!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! episodes.title: Diary of a Resourceful Investor - Using What You Have to Get What You Want
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: How to acquire real estate without cash or credit is one of the most popular (and abused) subjects in real estate investing.  We get questions about it all the time.Fortunately, in our travels we always meet interesting people.  And in this episode, we once again visit with our friend J Massey.  J has built a substantial portfolio starting with less than no money, and without ever using a bank loan.So, to quote Tony Robbins, if you're not making progress because you think you don't have what you need, "You don't lack resources.  You lack resourcefulness."Tune in and listen to how J's approach to real estate investing has made him one of the most resourceful real estate investors we know.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! episodes.title: Lots of Real Estate - Strategies for Investing in Land
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Land investing is a very unique aspect of real estate investing.  Raw land typically doesn't provide income or tax breaks.  And without a tenant to make the payments, there's no amortized equity.  Besides, with no income, borrowing to buy land can be risky business.So why do it?Well, there are lots of reasons.  And we discuss many of them on this episode of The Real Estate Guys™ Radio Show.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! Visit www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: How to Know if a Real Estate Market is for Real
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Markets get hot for different reasons.  And if you get into a rising market it can be a lot of fun.But when the tide of hot money roles out, does your market have a solid foundation for stability and recovery?As the economic ups and downs create bigger waves, the potential for profit and loss rise too.  And picking the right market for the right reason can make all the difference.To make sure you're on the winning side of these cycles, it's important to understand what makes a real estate market attractive to residents and the businesses that employ them.A critical component of resilient markets is infrastructure.  And not just any infrastructure, but the critical infrastructure that's going to be most likely to appeal to the type of people and businesses that make ideal tenants.In this episode of The Real Estate Guys radio show, we take a look at the topic of infrastructure and its essential role in a real estate market.  PLUS, we get a surprise visit from a special friend.Enjoy!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! Visit www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Beyond Entity Structure - Proactively Protecting Your Portfolio
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Sometimes you think you're covered, then you find there's a big hole in your asset protection.  Not only is it embarrassing, it can be very expensive.Sadly, most people's assets are exposed.  But not in the way you think.  And you may be one of them if you think simply setting up an LLC has you covered.  If only it were that simple!We've spent quite a bit of time over the years talking about using entities and off-shore strategies to protect your valuables, but there's also been a glaring hole in our coverage of the topic of asset protection: insurance.But this isn't the kind of insurance you see advertised on TV.  And our guest doesn't sell insurance.   He's a lawyer who helps investors and entrepreneurs make sure they have the right coverages - and when an insurer looks for loopholes to dodge the claim, he holds their feet to fire.You're going to like this show!  Take good notes!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! Visit www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.title: Live from the 2014 Investor Summit at Sea
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Summits are high level events where thought leaders and the most committed participants in any movement or process come together to share ideas, fortify relationships and gain important perspectives.
That's why our annual Investor Summit at Sea is SO much more than just another seminar, conference or cruise.
Our 12th edition in 2014 was arguably our best ever.  And that's saying a LOT.  They're all great, but 2014 was special because of the theme, the timing, the mix of people, and one of the most powerful collection of teachers we've ever had.
This episode was recorded on board the ship and features the reflections, epiphanies and comments from many of our stellar faculty members.
We can't wait to do it again!  We hope YOU decide to be with us for our 13th Annual Investor Summit at Sea in 2015!  All the details are available at www.realestateguysradio.com/summit.  Don't miss the boat!

episodes.title: Lessons and Opportunities from History with Simon Black
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Have you ever said, "If I knew that was going to happen, I would have invested differently"?Yes, it's true.  Hindsight is 20/20.  But is there a way to see into the future so you can make better investing decisions today?Our guest on this episode thinks so.  Not only is Simon Black a successful investor and entrepreneur, but he's an incessant traveler and a voracious student of history.We talk to him about the geo-political and economic changes occurring in the world today... and where his travels and studies suggest an astute investor might find great opportunities.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! episodes.title: Orlando, Florida - Not Just a Mickey Mouse Market
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: We thought we knew what Orlando and Florida were all about.  Sunshine, tourism and a haven for baby boomers and snowbirds.While all that's true, there's an even bigger story.  In fact, Florida is on pace to pass New York as the 3rd most populated state, and is behind only Texas in job creation.As you might imagine, all that population growth is great for the economy and even better for real estate.So we pay a visit to our friend Ryan Hinricher, who takes us on a tour and tells us all about it.  Then we grab the microphones and ask Ryan to tell YOU all about it.At the end, he offers a free report on his research.Enjoy!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show is a real estate investment talk program which provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Home builder confidence took a big dive while home prices continue to rise. Should we blame bad economic data on the cold weather?With housing commonly considered a bellweather of US economic health, pundits are perplexed by the mixed signals coming from sales, prices, jobless claims and mortgage activity.Since most financial news is written for paper asset investors and home owners, we thought we'd take a look at some clues in the news from a real estate investors perspective to see if clouds are forming or if sunny days are on the horizon.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show is a real estate investment talk program which provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subsribe to our free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.title: From The Archive - Practicing Safe Syndication
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Attorney Mauricio Rauld joins us to share important information that anyone raising money should be aware of.
Many people are seeing the big opportunity to raise money to do more and bigger deals.We think raising money is a great idea.  But it's not something to engage in casually. 
So if you decide to partner with investors, just be sure to use the proper protections including entities, agreements, disclosures and corporate formalities.This episode will get you pointed in the right direction.Enjoy!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.title: Creating Power Partnerships - Finding and Becoming the Right Partner
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Power is the ability to create motion...like a powerful locomotive, rocket ship or airplane.  People can be powerful too. A strong man can move heavy weights.
When it comes to building a successful portfolio or business, a powerful person has the ability to take effective action.  Efficient, energetic and focused forward.
Partnerships can combine the personal power of two or more people to make things happen bigger and faster. But just like when two or more horses are hitched together to pull a wagon, a powerful partnership takes some coordination.In this episode, we explore what it takes to put together powerful partnerships.  It may seem simple, but look at how many partnerships fail...costing not only money, but sometimes destroying friendships.
So listen in and discover what it takes to create powerful partnerships capable of moving mountains of obstacles in the pursuit of real estate investing profits!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.title: Booms, Busts and Bubbles - Watching Market Cycles
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Special guest Matt Kerkhoff writes for Richard Russell’s Dow Theory Letters.  He spends a lot of time watching the flows of money in and out of financial asset classes.  With the stock market at record highs, gold at 12 year lows and real estate returning to pre-crash levels in some markets, we want to know what’s coming next. 
Is there a new wave of wealth about to pour into real estate? Will the stock market crash and take real estate equity with it?  And where are interest rates headed?  Inquiring minds want to know!  Listen in and find out what Matt Kerkhoff thinks and why.
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Thinking Outside the Buck - How Savers Can Avoid Being Losers
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Our friend Robert Kiyosaki says "Savers are losers".  Does that mean you shouldn't save?  Of course not!As real estate prices rise and lending comes back into the market, real estate investors are going to be realizing profits - whether from sales or refinances.  Plus, the more properties you own, they more cash reserves you hold.In both cases, investors end up sitting on piles of dollars.  While that might sound good (it's better than the alternative), it also presents a challenge.  Even with the tiny taper, the Fed is still effectively printing $75 billion a month.  This has the potential to severely weaken the dollar.  If you have lots of dollars, then that's a problem for you.In this episode, we talk with special guest Anthem Blanchard who helps us understand precious metals as an alternative to dollars for the long term storage of wealth.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Who Moved the Door?  How Dodd-Frank Affects Your Exit Strategy
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Just when you think you have it all figured out, a new year and its new laws comes along and changes things up.In this episode, we take a look at a provision in the Dodd-Frank bill that limits how investors can use carry-back financing when exiting a property or a portfolio.  There's bad news...and there's good news!  In either case, you need to be aware. 
So tune in and find out what's changed and how it affects YOU.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.summary: The Guys answer another collection of great questions from the listeners!  In this episode, we talk about leverage and how the mortgage markets work; how to build relationships that protect and advance your interests; using technology to keep track of people and properties; and a special guest guru stops by to provide sage advice to those considering entering real estate as a profession.Plus, we invite your feedback on Halloween Horror stories and French Chateaus!Enjoy!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Perking Up Your Portfolio with Profit Producing Properties
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: The great thing about real estate is that there are so many ways to make money!  In this episode, we visit with a guy who creates cash flow from coffee beans.  Really.When you think of all the coffee consumed around the world, wouldn't it be great to get in on the action?  You can.It all starts with the coffee bean, which grows on coffee trees, which grow in real estate.  See the connection?It's easier than you think.  And when you hear about the low barrier to entry, high cash on cash returns, and the other perks available...well, we think your interest will percolate.So listen in to this fascinating interview and consider how you could caffeinate your cash flow with coffee farmland.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Exploring Your Options - Controlling Properties and Creating Profits
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Options are one of the most interesting, yet often misunderstood, tools in an investor's tool box.Wall Street investors use options to create profits, hedge positions, and speculate on uncertainty.Can Main Street investors do the same thing?To find out, we sit down with Rich Dad's Paper Asset Advisor, Andy Tanner.Andy tells us there are lots of similarities between paper asset options and real estate options.  And there's a lot that real estate investors can learn from paper asset option traders.Great!  We're eager to learn.  So we listen carefully as Andy explains what options are, how to use them to create and protect profits, and why options are a valuable weapon in the pursuit of profits for your portfolio.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Follow the Money - Clues to Where the Economy is Headed
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: From the floor of the New Orleans Investment Conference, we visit with fund manager Frank Holmes, best-selling author and radio personality Charles Goyette, and precious metals commentator Brien Lundin. After a full four days of educational sessions, presentation preparation and delivery, and lively conversations with fellow speakers and attendees, our brains are full.  SO fun.In this episode, we share our take aways and the perspectives of our guests about where the U.S. and global economies are headed.  While not everyone agrees on what lies ahead (some see storm clouds and others see sunny skies), we all agree there are lessons to be learned from following the money - and opening our minds to diverse perspectives in order to get the most accurate picture.So strap in and get ready for another stimulating episode of  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Rehabbing Realities - A Serial Flipper Tells All
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Rehabbing is a rite of passage for most real estate investors.  Nearly everyone tries it.  But some people turn it into a thriving business.  How?In this episode, we sit down face to face with professional rehabber Terry Kerr.  For over a decade, Terry's built a booming business buying, fixing up, renting and selling single family homes.And Terry didn't just come in after the crash to help clean up the mess (though he's a major contributor to the effort!).  He started before the bottom fell out and not only survived the bust, but thrived through it.  So he's been there, done that - and is still doing it today!One thing we've leared from truly successful people is that they're happy to share the lessons they've learned along the way.So listen in as Terry shares practical tips, guiding principles and insider secrets that have shaped his career.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Making the Jump to Commercial Property
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: When investors are ready to trade in their little green houses for something bigger, there are more choices than just apartments.  In this episode, we talk office properties with commercial agent and real estate investor Craig Coppola.Savvy residential real estate investors pay attention to their local commercial markets because office and industrial absorption can provide important clues about the local economy and job market.  After all, residential tenants have to work some place - and many work in commercial properties,And while there are similarities between commercial and residential investing, there are also some important differences.  So whether you're thinking of making the jump from residential to commercial or you simply want to use the commercial market for insights into your local economy, listen into our discussion with commercial property veteran Craig Coppola.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Agricultural Real Estate Investing for Cash Flow, Equity Growth and Asset Protection
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Whether times are good, bad, uncertain or chaotic, it always makes sense to focus on fundamentals.  And there's nothing more fundamental than food.So even though the world is in the "information" age, it didn't leave industry or agriculture.  New opportunities don't mean old ones disappear or aren't attractive.  And when the value of something as central to commerce as currency is falling into question, where can investors go not just to hedge, but to profit?In this episode, we visit with the CEO of an international investment company.  He shares with us the path of discovery his firm and clients explored in the wake of the 2008 financial crisis.  The conclusions they came to and where those led to are the focus of the conversation.  We found it fascinating and think you will too!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Crowdfunding Update - The Next Phase of Connecting Dollars and Deals
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
We think crowdfunding will be to connecting dollars to deals what social media has been to connecting people.  Yeah, it could be THAT big. So we went out to the 2nd annual Crowdfunding Bootcamp to find out more. 
Of course, we took our mobile microphones. While we were there we chatted with the leading law firm in the space (yes, there are rules to follow), a super-bright crowdfunding real estate entrepreneur (yes, people are already doing it), a honcho for the Small Business Council (you can fund start-ups too!), and three of The Real Estate Guys™ listening audience who happened to be in attendance (good things happen when you get out and about!)
It was a great time, we learned a lot, and we’re excited to share snippets of the experience with you!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Real Asset Investing - Using Hard Assets to Hedge Against a Falling Dollar
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: The dollar has been on a steady decline since Nixon took it off the gold standard in 1971.  The result is inflation and it's one of the reasons equity happens.Quantitative Easing (QE) is one of the significant contributing factors to a falling dollar.  As China becomes vocal in its calls to abandon the U.S. dollar as the world's reserve currency, alert investors are preparing their portfolios for a further falling dollar.What does all this mean for real estate investors?  And is there a way to profit?Tune in to this episode as The Guys discuss how real asset investing can help investors both survive and thrive the demise of the dollar.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Government Shutdown and Debt Ceiling Debate - Ramifications for Investors
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Because the US dollar is the reserve currency of the world, what happens in Washington DC and at the Federal Reserve has a big effect on the rest of the world.
Likewise, how the world responds to Washington and the Fed affects the strength of the US dollar, which in turn affects interest rates.  And interest rates affect real estate investors.So while the government shutdown is one level of stress, a possible debt default is a potential crisis of much larger proportions. 
How will it all play out?  While a traditional default is unlikely, it's very likely the debt ceiling will be raised and the dollar will continue its slow and steady slide. 
When you're buying a property and getting a loan for the long term, the long term direction of the dollar creates both challenges and opportunities every real estate investor should be aware of.Listen in as The Guys discuss the government shutdown and the great debt ceiling debate on The Real Estate Guys™ radio show!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.title: Retirement Account Real Estate Investing - Borrow, Lend or Partner
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Retirement accounts hold trillions of dollars.  Almost all of it is in the hands of Wall Street through stocks, bonds, mutual funds and annuities.  For those who want to move their money closer to Main Street, real estate, precious metals and private placements are an appealing alternative.
In this episode, The Real Estate Guys™ talk to self-directed individual retirement account expert Glen Mather about all the exciting options.
Though many investors have already discovered the powerful benefits of self-directed retirement account investing, the vast majority of investors falsely believe that Wall Street is their only option.  And even those familiar with the idea of self-direction may not be up to speed on the latest and greatest innovations.
So listen and learn as The Real Estate Guys™ talk about how you can harness the power of individual retirement accounts to help yourself and others grow their portfolio with real assets.

episodes.summary: Like it or not, lawyers and legal bills are a fact of life for real estate investors.  In this episode, The Real Estate Guys™ discuss some of the kinds of lawyers you’ll need, what you should think about when setting up your legal team, and some practical tips for getting more bang for your buck.Best of all, there are no lawyers on the show, so we can invoke talk show host / listener privilege.  Enjoy!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Clues in the News - Fools Rush In - Beware a Jobless Recovery
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Headlines are sending mixed messages about housing, jobs and economic recovery.  It can be SO confusing!In this episode, The Real Estate Guys™ take a look at some of the recent news and discuss what it means to everyday real estate investors.Liars, tigers, bears and some bull all help muddy the water.  Asset prices (stocks, houses, etc) are up, but ss that based on supply and demand or inflation?  And what about jobs?  If you take a full time job and divide it into two part-time jobs, did you reduce unemployment?  And what about that pesky falling labor participation rate?Yes, Virginia, all these things matter to real estate investors because we can't just jump in and out of positions the way stock traders do.  Real estate investing is about marrying a market for a decade or two, so it's important to understand the probabilities of your tenants having jobs that pay enough to afford the rent down the road.So listen in to this episode as The Real Estate Guys™ dig for useful clues in the news!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: It’s baaack!Yes, it’s true.  Equity is back and it’s happening in major metropolitan real estate markets.Surprised?  You shouldn’t be.  These cycles and their causes are highly predictable.  It’s seldom an issue of IF, but more of WHEN.And while it’s fun to talk macro-economics in the clouds of conversation, it’s also important to descend to the street level and find out what’s happening on the ground.So for this episode, we sit down with returning guest Ken Corsini and pick his brain about what’s happening in one of the best appreciating markets in the USA:  Atlanta, Georgia.Listen in and find out what Ken thinks is the cause of over 20% price appreciation of single family homes in Atlanta.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.summary: Ron Black of Texas Investor Homes is our guest on this episode as we explore the opportunities in NEW home investing.  All things being equal, your tenants and property managers would rather have a new home than an older one.  A new property means less headaches and expenses.But in today's economy, new homes don't work in every market.  However, Texas has been leading the U.S. in job creation for the last few years, and Houston was recently names the top jobs market in the country.Do brand new, positive cash flow properties in Houston make sense?  Find out in this episode of The Real Estate Guys™ Radio Show!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.title: From the Floor at Freedom Fest - Coffee, Coins and Capital Controls
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
The real estate we invest in floats in an economic sea teeming with other financial and political life forms,  Each of these denizens of the dollar plays a role in the financial ecology.  There are symbiotic relationships, predators and prey, natural and man-made disasters, and a host of other factors which affect the performance and prospects of our real estate.We like attending Freedom Fest each year because we always meet interesting people who give us fascinating perspectives on financial markets and vehicles that we don't always study as closely as we do real estate.In the episode, we look at the symbiotic relationship between agricultural commodities and real estate, what the precious metals markets can tell us about the strength of the dollar, what might cause and how we would be affected by strong armed governmental intervention in capital markets, and much more!So strap on your thinking cap and listen in as we dive into a discussion with a variety of interesting guests from the floor of Freedom Fest 2013.

episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: If you haven't done anything wrong, does that mean you don't have anything to hide?Sadly, real estate investors are easy targets for frivolous lawsuits, vindictive tenants and financial scam artists.  Why?  Because property values, loan amounts (and therefore equity) and title information are all part of the very public record.  And when you can't hide the asset (rental properties are big and immobile), the next best thing is to hide the ownership.In this episode, The Real Estate Guys™ talk about the why and how of organizing your life for optimum privacy.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
If you have more deals than money, then it's time to go beyond yourself and enter the wild, wonderful world of OPM (Other People's Money).  Using OPM doesn't mean you're auditioning for a starring role in a future episode of American Greed.  There are people and institutions who have more money than time or investing talent, and they're looking for honest, hard-working, capable people like YOU to invest with.  Sometimes they loan you money.  Sometimes they want a piece of the action.  Sometimes they want both.  In all cases, you can solve their problem while creating a big opportunity for yourself.
In this episode, The Real Estate Guys™ share several keys to raising capital and leaping over the limits of your own financial statements.

Meanwhile, Carl Palmer is the world famous drummer from the classic rock bank Emerson, Lake and Palmer.  Today he's performing with his new group, The Carl Palmer Band.  He's also created one of the most unique and intriguing kinds of collectible art that we've ever seen.  What does any of that have to do with real estate investing?  Listen in and find out!James and Carl don’t know each other, but now you’ll get to know them both.  Plus you’ll hear what we think some of the important take-aways are for real estate investors because there's a lot to learn when you're willing to go out exploring.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.title: Ask The Guys - Credit and Credibility
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
You've got questions,  we've got answers...or at least our best guesses!  In this Ask The Guys episode, Robert and Russ reach into the email grab bag and pull out random (but very interesting) questions.  As often happens, a theme emerged.  In a business where OPM (Other People's Money) is standard operating procedure, we discover that your crebility is even more important than your credit score.  So listen in and learn how you can expand your real estate empire by leveraging who you are, who you know and how you're perceived.  Plus, we'll answer several other interesting questions from our fabulous audience!
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Clues in the News - The Market is Speaking...Are You Listening?
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
We like to peruse the news looking for clues we can use (and words that rhyme).  Unlike reports that look back on the past, the daily news is talking about what's happening now.  Much more useful.When it comes to real estate market cycles (and pretty much any kind of financial cycle), we've observed that the pendulum swings both ways.  In case you were in a coma, 10 years ago we were on the front end of a huge updward surge in real estate values.  Five years ago, real estate hit a litle bump in the road to riches called the greatest financial disaster since the Great Depression.  Ouch.
Of course, as bad as all that was for some people, it's been a buying bonanza for the brave and the bold.  And today the headlines tell us that real estate is coming back across nearly every sector.  In other words, we could be on verge of a surge.What does it all mean?  That's what we discuss on this episode of The Real Estate Guys radio show!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! Visit www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.title: Musical Chairs - Profiting from Demographic Shifts
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Shift happens.  And when it does, it sometimes affects supply and demand,  When you're on the right side of a supply and demand imbalance, you can make a lot of money!
Our special guest for this episode is John Turley.  Big John spends a lot of time watching the migation of baby boomers into retirement areas and he's noticed something interesting.  There are a LOT more boomers looking to retire abroad than there are great retirement destinations! 
Will this result in bidding wars?  Find out when you listen to this exciting episode op The Real Estate Guys radio show!

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Searching the Globe for Real Estate, Banking and Privacy
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: There’s no place like home.  Or is there?Many investors pick properties in whatever area they happen to live in.  That's a fabulous strategy if you happen to live in a great investment market.We say, “Live where you want to live, but invest where the numbers make sense.”  You may get a lot more bang for your buck by picking markets where prices, rents, market conditions and other factors all produce better profits.But, is it possible that there’s more to investing than simply return on investment?We think so.  Many investors are interested in things like privacy, asset protection, lifestyle, and even personal security.Of course, to put all of these choices in context, it’s important to have a broader perspective.  A great way to see the bigger picture is to travel.  The next best thing is to talk with people who travel.In this episode, we talk with the most interesting “homeless” man you’ll probably never meet. Our guest Simon Black is a “perpetual traveler”.  He spends his time traveling the world, seeking opportunities and sharing his perspectives with people smart enough to listen.An interesting perspective Simon shares are his observations about the relationship between global agriculture and opportunities in real estate investment.  So if you’re hungry for unique investment strategies, this episode will whet your appetite!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources that help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

Technology is changing how people live, work and play.  But real estate investing is still a people business, and the key to great relationships with people is communication. 
In this episode, host Robert Helms visits with his dad, the Godfather of Real Estate, who’s been in the real estate investing and brokerage business from the first day God created dirt. Bob shares some of the changes he’s embraced over his decades in the business.
Then Robert chats with internet marketing guru Pol vanRhee. Technology is changing how small business attracts customers.  Whether you’re searching for properties or service providers, or using the internet to attract tenants or market your properties, there are things you need to know to stay competitive in a rapidly changing world.

episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Predicting the past is easy.  The future can be a little bit trickier.  Yet every time this year, pundits and prognosticators of all stripes are out in force, proclaiming to the world what they think the future holds.  And since we're real estate junkies, we try to listen to everything everyone says, then sift through it to see what makes sense for real estate investors.
In this episode, host Robert Helms takes a look at some of the predictions in the market place - along with some perspectives and precautions of his own.  Listen in and see what makes sense to you!

episodes.title: Competing in a Down Market with New Construction
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Sooner or later, new construction needs to happen, at least in residential.  Between immigration and new births, population keeps growing in many areas.But when the economy is soft, building a big tract of new homes can be risky business.  And in some of the most popular areas, there are no big tracts of land to develop even if it made financial sense.Besides, how can a little guy compete with the big guys?  You can't.  At least not head to head.BUT, a nimble, boutique developer actually has a huge competitive edge by focusing on in-fill projects that fit well into a particular market and demographic.To learn more about how a small developer can make big money in a down market, host Robert Helms visits with Washington DC based boutique developer, Beth Clifford.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! Real estate is BIG business.  And there are MANY different ways to make money, both as an investor and as a businessperson. In this episode, The Guys take a look real estate as a profession and some of the various ways people make money when it’s their day job. 
Some investors choose to get into the business as a way to get closer to people, deals and important data.  Others do it because they love a particular aspect of it.  Some choose a real estate related business because they can make a lot of money to then invest in their own portfolio.

episodes.title: Taking Control of Your Retirement Account - Alternative Capital to Fund Your Real Estate Investing
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Finding money to take advantage of the many great bargains in today’s real estate market can be challenging.  Easy cash out loans and the equity they created are largely gone, so investors have been looking for alternatives.  One of the still largely underutilized sources of investment capital on most people’s balance sheets are retirement accounts. This is partly because the traditional financial services industry has had a virtual monopoly in this space and consumers remain somewhat ignorant of their non-traditional options.  Also, many investors don’t consider their retirement funds to be highly manageable and tend to leave them on auto-pilot.  But for those who want to take control of their retirement investments, there are many opportunities to self-direct away from Wall Street and into tangible assets like real estate, physical metals or notes directly tied to real estate both domestically and offshore.  Our guest in this episode is Larry Grossman, who specializes in helping people comply with all the rules regarding self-directed individual retirement accounts.  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! Visit www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: As much as we love making money, we all know there's more to life than just making money.In this epsiode, we talk with a woman who has overcome a number of obstacles to achieve success in business, investing and even in parenting!Rita Khagram was born into a culture that didn't empower women.  Undeterred she set off to make it in business, but at an enormous personal price.Determined to repair her relationship with her daughter, she sold her successful business and because she didn't get good advice, ended up losing everything.But she didn't give up.After investing in her own investing education and seeking out wise counsel, Rita applied her new wisdom to acquire a large portfolio of properties and build another successful business.  And she rebuilt her relationship with her daughter.Then a profound experience on the streets of India have given her a higher purpose for her money-making ventures.  Now her life is more focused and fulfilling than ever.You're going to be inspired and encouraged when you hear Rita's story.  Enjoy!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training, perspectives and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

Sam Freshman began his real estate investing career in 1957 and founded his syndication company in 1961.  Since then he’s been involved in deals exceeding $500 million.  And when you consider the price of real estate in the 60’s, 70’s and 80’s, that's a LOT of deals!
