episodes.title: Sharpen Your Pencil and Do the Math - Utilizing the Formulas of Real Estate Investing
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
An essential skill for every rental property investor big or small is knowing how to do accurate financial analysis. Without it, how do you know if a property is a good deal, how it compares to other properties; or whether it's a good time to buy, sell or refinance?
These are just some of the very important questions a prudent rental property investor needs to know how to find the answers to.  That's why we say “Do the math and the math will tell you what to do!”
So the topic of this episode is an overview of the 7 essential formulas of rental property financial analysis.  You'll learn what they are, why they're important and how to use them.
Sound scary?  Hey, it's only math.  And it’s not as bad as getting into a property expecting positive cash flow and finding out you’re really negative; or buying into an overheated market, or not getting out while the getting’s good.  Good financial analysis can save you a LOT of heartache!
So listen in as The Real Estate Guys™ teach you how to sharpen your pencil and do the math!
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.summary: Our special guest for this episode is YOU!  We've sorted through the hundreds of questions received over the last several weeks and picked out as many as we could to answer on the air.To get great answers, you have to ask great questions.  Sometimes the great question is less about how and more about why.  As famed business philosopher, the late great Jim Rohn often said, "When the why becomes clear, the how becomes obvious."This particular batch of questions came out with a little more focus on the why.  We think you'll like it.So listen in as hosts Robert Helms and Russell Gray answer listener questions on yet another edifying episode of Ask The Guys.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education,  training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com Connect with The Real Estate Guys on Facebook.  Facebook.com/TheRealEstateGuys

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: The Global Perspective - Where Investors Are Going and Why
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Host Robert Helms travels to Orlando Florida to attend the Encounter of the Americas conference which is hosted by RE/MAX.  
This event brings company leaders and agents together from all over the world, with an emphasis on Latin America and the Caribbean. 
RE/MAX is one of the biggest brands in real estate brokerage with an especially strong international presence.  So they're able to help us gain a global perspective about where money is flowing in and out of real estate.
At the event, Robert sits down with three of the top guys at RE/MAX, each offering unique insights.
Larry Oberly is VP of International development, who helps RE/MAX expand its network around the globe.  By collecting data from local offices, monitoring search activity on the RE/MAX website and having high level conversations with international industry leaders, Larry helps us do one of our favorite things:  anticipate where the puck is going.  He has some interesting comments about China that you want to listen to.
Next, Robert talks to Ricardo Cardenas who is the RE/MAX VP of Latin America and the Caribbean.  As part of the emerging growth countries known as BRIC (Brazil, Russia, India and China), Brazil is the dominant economy of Latin America.  
But it isn't the only strong economy in the south side of the Western Hemisphere.  And as these nations make more money, they are diligently working on improving their business systems, including how real estate brokerage is done.  RE/MAX is playing a leadership role in that process.  
Just as software protocols have made various devices more compatible and easier to use, so will improving business protocols improve access to properties and the ease and security of doing business.  This helps pave the way for more capital to move into those real estate markets.
Last, but certainly not least, Robert reconnects with John Turley, our good friend and top broker in the country of Belize.  John visits face to face with real life buyers every day, so while we appreciate the big picture view of high level execs, we like to balance that with street level insights from guys like John.  He brings us up to speed on the latest and greatest about Belize.  
We are pleasantly surprised to learn that tourism is substantially up over last year’s record highs.  It’s also interesting that while much of the world experienced severe price declines throughout the recession, Belize did not.  And tourism is actually higher now than before the recession hit.  Very interesting.
There’s a lot here, so turn up your volume and enjoy!
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  
Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.title: Hotel Impossible or Can You Make Money in Lodging and Hospitality?
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Hospitality as a business involves using real estate to provide services to leisure and business travelers.  That’s pretty straight forward.  As real estate investors, any time there’s real estate producing cash flow, we’re interested.  And when you do the math based on nightly cash flows, the numbers look pretty good! But this type of real estate investing is very different than your run-of-the-mill rental home, so to avoid ending up with a heartbreak hotel, it's wise to do some homework before investing.  
To learn more about the opportunities and the state of the lodging and hospitality industry in the current economy, listen in as The Real Estate Guys sit down with Eric Stoessel, Managing Editor for Lodging Hospitality magazine.  
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.title: Getting a Slice of the Pie - Sharing Real Estate to Vacation Better

episodes.summary:
Host Robert Helms travels to Orlando Florida and attends the 14th Annual Shared Ownership Conference.  
So what exactly is "Shared Ownership"?  
Great question!  And the answer is this extra long episode of The Real Estate Guys radio show - including a huge collection of interviews with experts on the topic.

The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed. Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Corporate Formalities - Making Sure Your Asset Protection Strategy Really Works
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Most savvy real estate investors know it’s a good idea to put each property in a limited liability company.  More complex strategies include setting up management companies, holding companies and can even include an offshore component.
The basic idea is to create a legal entity (corporation, LLC, etc.) or network of entities through which various aspects of your business activities are conducted. And to NEVER do business as a natural person in your own name.  
Once you get your mind around it, it’s ALMOST fun putting it all together.  Unfortunately, that’s where it ends for too many investors.  And as you might guess...the devil's in the details.
Attorney Garrett Sutton tells us it's important to not only set up a solid structure, but to maintain it properly.  How?  By being careful to observe “corporate formalities”.  
To find out what those are and why they're important, listen in as we talk with Robert Kiyosaki's Rich Dad Advisor for Asset Protection, Garrett Sutton.  Discover how to run your own corporation and better protect your real estate empire!
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Rhetoric and Reality - A Look at the History of Economic Policy
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
The overall health of the US economy affects jobs, incomes and asset values - including investment real estate.  Throughout one of the most hotly contested presidential elections in recent memory, economic policy has been a central theme.  
At their convention, the Democrats invoked the spirit (and oration) of ex-President Bill Clinton, while the GOP conjures up visions of Reaganomics. Dire predictions of fiscal cliffs, defaults, hyper-inflation, depression, civil unrest and other calamities fuel the debate.  It seem that everyone has an opinion.
But what does history say?  
To find out, we sit down with Dr. Jeffrey Hummel, a professor of both economics and history.  We think both are important to providing the context for our investing decisions. So grab your note pad and listen in!  
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Ask The Guys - Making the Move to More Units
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Another exhilarating episode of Ask The Guys!  Robert and Russ answer your questions...
With only $20,000 to invest and living overseas, which U.S. markets make sense?
Does size matter?  A Minneapolis investor is enjoying great cash flow on smaller properties, but feels the urge to go big.  Should he?
A Texas investor is stacking up cash flow properties and wants to retire in Belize in 12 years. Great idea! But should he accelerate the loans or leverage into more properties?  What's the shortest path to "critical mass"?
A New York investor wants to know if she should use off the shelf deal analysis software or build her own spreadsheet.  What's a diligent investor to do?
A rookie investor from Minnesota is flipping his first deal - a single family home. He wants to know how to build a true investment business with multi-unit buildings. How can he go from forcing equity to collecting passive cash flow?
Another New York investor with 12 residential propeties wants to crack the commercial code.  What do the lenders look for?  How can he make the leap?
A land owner in New Jersey is looking for investors - presumably to help develop the property.  He's tried investor clubs, bars and dating services (just kidding) with no luck.  Where can he go to find the funding partners he needs?
A California couple have an expensive home that's paid for, a bunch of cash in a low rate CD, and a half million in retirements accounts.  They're doing great...but want to own more real estate.  How can they get there from here?
We love your questions!  To submit yours, visit www.realestateguysradio.com and click on Ask The Guys!
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Finding Inspiration - Your Next Billion Dollar Idea with Mark Victor Hansen
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Chicken Soup for the Soul co-author Mark Victor Hansen is our guest for this episode.  As a mega best-selling author and world famous public speaker, Mark’s lifestyle and profession requires lots of positive energy and creativity.  The same is true for real estate investors.  
So we asked Mark to sit down and share some of himself with us to see if we could pick up some great ideas from this iconic personality.  
Wow, talk about drinking from a firehouse!  So strap in and get ready for a wild ride with the ever energetic Mark Victor Hansen.  
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Surviving the Fiscal Cliff - Ramifications for Real Estate Investors
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
CPA Tom Wheelwright gives us his take on "The Fiscal Cliff" that the U.S. economy is said to be headed for at the end of 2012.
What is "The Fiscal Cliff"?  Should real esttate investors be concerned?  What should investors do to prepare?
Sometimes problems are exaggerated and sometimes they're hidden when election year hype hits the headlines. Listen in and find out what CPA Tom Wheelwright says investors need to know and do amid the uncertainty.
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed. Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: In Search of Goldilocks - Bearing with Government When Investing
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Is government too big, too small or just right?  And what does this have to do with real estate investing?
To help us explore this controversial and timely topic, Steve Forbes comes back to share his thoughts, as does first time guest Tom Woods.  In a very polarized election year for the U.S., many people are paying close attention.  As real estate investors, we care about how rules, regulations and even rhetoric affect our investments.  
Property taxes, zoning, rent control, eminent domain, environmental controls, fair housing; Fannie, Freddie, FHA and much more are all examples of how government affects real estate.   To win at the game of real estate investing, you need to know the rules.  And when the rules are subject to change (and they are), it’s important to anticipate trends and adjust accordingly.The bottom line which affects your bottom line is that government is in the market to stay, so don’t get frustrated.  Be fascinated. Because, as we learn, confusion in the market creates opportunity for the alert - and tension in the process can actually be a very good thing.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: The Real Deal - Digging Beneath the Headlines to Exploit Opportunity
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: We’re big fans of looking for clues in the news to help us gauge the mood of the market, monitor trends and seek out new opportunities.  But sometimes headlines hide what’s really happening at the street level.  That’s why it’s important to have people in place you can call to get the real scoop.  In this episode, we call on our man in Memphis, Terry Kerr, to help us determine if recent gloomy headlines really reflect the reality of that particular market.  What we discover is that experience, critical mass, local relationships and creativity not only compensate, but can actually help capitalize on the “problems” in any market.  In fact, once again, we find that most problems are really opportunities dressed in work clothes.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Bonds, Dividends and Wealth Management - How Other Investments Relate to Real Estate
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Special guests include bond market expert Steven McDonald and dividend investing guru and author Mark Lichtenfield from The Oxford Club; and David Conover, President of Wealth Management at Everbank.  Yes, bonds. stocks and banking on a real estate show.  But for good reason! 
We’ve been talking forever about the connection between the bond market and the mortgage market - and the powerful influence the bond market has on interest rates and overall availability of capital.  And not just for real estate investors, but job creators (it's better when tenants have jobs) and consumers (businesses do better when people buy stuff).  So even though he’s not a real estate guy, we really bonded with Steve (sorry, we couldn't help ourselves).
Mark talks about the important of investing for income.  Of course, he means stocks that pay dividends, but we like the idea.  Buy an equity that cash flows.  Great concept!  That way if inflation goes up, so does your asset value, and if not, well then you just cash flow, flow, flow your boat merrily down the stream.
What about David?  Well, banks are basically warehouses where real estate investors store their extra dollars, including the float on their cash flow.  And it’s a big concern when the Fed is diluting the value of those dollars, so what’s an investor to do?  After all, you can’t deploy all your cash all the time, or you might wake up one day with a major liquidity problem.  David tells us how you can dump dollars, still be liquid and have FDIC insurance. More, we learn how a banking executive looks at the current market and what he thinks the future holds.
So listen in on the conversation as we talk bonds, dividends and wealth management with Steve McDonald and David Conover.
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.comLearn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: A Midsummer Investor's Dream - Housing, Jobs, Consumer Confidence and Economics
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Bad news for housing can be great news for investors.  But it means seeing a bigger picture and reading between the lines.  For this episode, we do back to back interviews with two special guests.  First, we visit with Gene Epstein, who is the former chief economist for the New York Stock Exchange and current economics editor for Barron’s magazine.   Next, we chat with Anthony Randazzo who is the director of economic research for Reason Foundation. Anthony specializes in housing finance and macroeconomic policy.  They’re both braniacs, so we ask them for their thoughts on the economy - and at first blush, it looks bad.  But after digging a little deeper, we wrap up pretty excited about the opportunities for real estate investors today.  Take a listen!  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Banking, Monetary Policy and Real Estate
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Our special guest is G. Edward Griffin, the author of The Creature from Jekyll Island - a Second Look at the Federal Reserve.  Whatever you think about the motives and contributions of the Fed, there is no denying the profound impact it has on the supply and cost of capital.  2013 Summit at Sea faculty member Peter Schiff says Fed policy, dating back to Alan Greenspan in the 90’s and carried on to the present day by Big Ben Bernanke, is primarily responsible for the mortgage meltdown and resulting foreclosure crisis.  What does it all mean to real estate investors?  That’s what we talk about in this intriguing episode.  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Analyzing Real Estate Markets in a Changing Economy
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
A bad market can doom a “great deal”.  And a strong market can make a mediocre deal a winner.  While you might be able to fix up a bad property, what can an individual investor do to re-hab a bad market?  Not a lot!  So it’s REALLY important to pick a great market before you start loading up the shopping cart with all those bargain properties.  
In this episode of The Real Estate Guys™ radio show Robert, Russ and the Godfather share precious and practical pearls of prescient wisdom to help you peer into the perils of property markets and pick places prone to perform positively.
Remember: a rising tide lifts all boats.  So listen and learn how you can analyze real estate markets and find the best one for you.
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Saving a Mortgage When Banks Won’t Deal - Leveraging the Law to Stop Foreclosure
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: The mortgage crisis still isn’t over for millions of property owners.  There are many resulting ramifications, but in this episode we focus specifically on how a property owner can stop, stall, and in some cases actually overturn an improper foreclosure.  Real estate agents and investors can use these techniques to buy more time to negotiate a short sale, and troubled borrowers can find more time (and leverage) to negotiate a loan modification.  Our expert guest reveals how banks have routinely violated the foreclosure laws, and why the government settlement doesn’t protect the banks from civil litigation.  Knowing how to hold the bank’s feet to the fire is the secret to successfully stalling an illegal foreclosure.   Tune in and find out for yourself how to use this powerful tool to make deals that you might otherwise miss.  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.comSaving a Mortgage When Banks Won’t Deal - Leveraging the Law to Stop Foreclosure

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Ask The Guys - No Investor Left Behind
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Interest in real estate investing is picking up based on the number of questions coming in from our listeners.  Of course, it probably helps that The Real Estate Guys radio show is the most downloaded podcast on iTunes and Apple is one of the most successful companies on earth.  It’s fun to be us.
In this episode of Ask The Guys, we field a variety of excellent questions from all over…including Indiana, New York, Alberta (Canada), Washington DC , Montana, Facebook (wherever that is), and more!  Wow.  The Real Estate Guys are a global farce….er, force.
We even respond to one listener who didn’t like a political comment made by one of our guests.  Well, it is that season and do you smell that?  Yes, politics is in the air.  And as long as politicians and their policies affect investors and our investing, we’re going to have to talk about what those rascals are doing.  And just like personal investment philosophy, we’re not all going to agree.  Not sure why people get their undies so knotted up when it comes to politics.  After all, that’s just one of many things we can all disagree about.  Some people like to drink light beer.  Can you imagine?  Whatever.
Anyway, we had fun doing the show and love getting your questions. So keep ‘em coming!  Meanwhile, tune in and enjoy this exhilarating edition of Ask The Guys!
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Turning Adversity Into Opportunity - How Real Estate Saved My Family
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Will Smith brought the world the heart-warming story of a down-on-his-luck real life Chris Gardner in The Pursuit of Happyness.  In the film, Smith portrays Gardner, a homeless single father who lands a job as a stockbroker and with true grit and determination becomes a financial success.  Not to be outdone by Wall Street, we found a real estate investing version that will inspire (and challenge) you!  There are lots of lessons, so grab your notepad and listen in to this enriching episode!  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Dark Shadows - Are Lurking Foreclosures Sucking the Blood Out of Recovery?
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Shadow inventory is a term used to describe gobs of distressed properties, mostly single family residential, that isn't yet on the market.  Statisticians look at top down data like bank reports and public filings.  But what about a street level view? 
Atlanta, Georgia has been one of the stat leaders for foreclosures, so we thought it would be interesting to sit down with a guy who spends a lot of his time scouring the Atlanta market looking for distressed houses.  More foreclosures is good for buyers, but if you buy now and then get hit with a new wave of foreclosures, you could see your values take yet another dive.  Of course, if you're comfortably cash flowing you can afford to wait it out. But still, buying something that drops in value can be disconcerting.  It's called "catching a falling knife".  Then again, if you wait for a recovery to prove itself, you may miss out on some great bargains. 
So we want to know: is a legion of zombie properties lurking in the dark shadows of the market - or are we on our way to a more stable and long term appreciating market?  Tune in and see what our special guest Ken Corsini says he sees when he ventures into the market looking for bargains.  
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed. Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Schiff Happens - Is The Real Crash Yet to Come?
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Peter Schiff is our guest for this episode. In his 3rd appearance on The Real Estate Guys radio show, Schiff tells us about his latest book, "The Real Crash - America’s Coming Bankruptcy".  Scary title (and you thought the Mayan calendar thing was alarming)!  But remember:  In his 2006 book, "Crash Proof" Peter Schiff was right about the mortgage meltdown. So this time we're all ears. In this interview, Peter reminds us that in his follow up book, "Crash Proof 2.0", he also predicted how the Fed and the government would react to the mortgage meltdown: with massive stimulus (a.k.a. printing currency).  Once again, Peter Schiff was right.  In "The Real Crash - America’s Coming Bankruptcy", Peter Schiff warns that the ultimate crash will be caused by the ultimate bubble: government bonds and the U.S. dollar.  Now he may or may not be right this time, but we're sure you’ll want to hear what he has to say.  The good news is that according to Peter, there are things you can do right now to protect yourself.  Curious?  Then tune in and make some Schiff happen to you! The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.   Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Economics, Politics and Freedom - Making Financial Decisions in an Election Year
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: U.S. election year political rhetoric has already hit high gear, but we’re sure the best (worst?) is yet to come.  And you can bet tinkering with the economy is going to be a major part of the conversation - probably more so than any time since 1992 and Bill Clinton’s now famous slogan, “It’s the economy, stupid.”   As real estate investors, we care deeply about things like the supply and cost of capital, job creation and tax rates.  And while we can’t control what happens, we sure want to anticipate it - especially if big changes are being proposed.  End the Fed?  Return to a gold standard?  Raise taxes on capital gains?  Eliminate the mortgage deduction?  Lions, tigers and bears? Oh my!  What’s an investor to do?  Well, start by paying attention to people who are paying attention.  To help you, we traveled to the Las Vegas Money Show to sit down face to face with our good friend, economist and outspoken political opiner, Dr. Mark Skousen.  As the founder of Freedom Fest, Mark Skousen is one of most connected and intellectually honest people we know.  Every time we sit with Mark, we learn and we’re sure you will too.  So tune in and find out what Dr. Skousen sees for the economy and economic policy as the United States  enters one of the more interesting election years in recent history.   The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Bigger Deals, Bigger Profits – Great News for Real Estate Entrepreneurs
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: At a time when everyone is crying about how Uncle Sam is making it hard to do business, real estate entrepreneurs are getting a break.  Actually, ALL entrepreneurs are getting a break, but since we’re The Real Estate Guys, we’re excited about the real estate angle.  The short of it is that the recently passed JOBS Act will make it easier for new businesses to raise start-up capital through “crowd funding”.  To tell us all about, we welcome back special guest, attorney Mauricio Rauld.  So grab your notepad and listen in to another informative episode of The Real Estate Guys™ radio show!  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Healing Commercial Property Woes - The Trillion Dollar Challenge
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Over $1.7 trillion of commercial mortgages are coming due in the short term.  In a normal world, that debt would be refinanced and life goes on.  But today, many of those properties are underwater and there just aren’t as many lenders willing to refinance these loans.  In fact, our guest says that over $1 trillion of those loans will need to be re-negotiated.  Why?  Well, when you owe the bank a $10,000 you have a problem, but when you owe the bank $10 million, the bank has a problem.  And when banks lose a trillion dollars, we all have a problem.  It’s a complex topic with many nuances and lots of lessons.  Our expert guest Phil Jemmet runs a company that specializes in large balance commercial loan workouts.  He gives us a street level perspective and explains the process for getting these big problems down to a manageable size.  Your problems may be smaller (for now), but the principles of dealing with them are very similar.  So listen and learn as Phil Jemmet shares his secrets for reworking loans that are no longer working for you.  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Catching the Wave - Where Tropical Profits are a Breeze
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
One of the secrets to making a lot of money is to catch a profitable wave.  Sounds interesting, but what does it mean?  Well, a financial wave happens when a variety of forces converge to move people or their money in a particular direction. That movement can have a substantial impact on any given asset class or geographic region - and the effect can be much more pronounced when the asset class or region is very limited in size.   That's why we've been intrigued over the years by the tiny country of Belize. 
In this episode, The Real Estate Guys™ are on location at a beautiful beachfront resort on tropical Ambergris Caye (yes, it’s a rough life on the road as radio talk show hosts).  Here, we meet up with the #1 real estate broker in the country, who’s also the #2 international broker in the world for the #1 real estate brokerage in the world.  Yeah, he’s pretty big.  But he’s humble.  And he says the secret to his huge success is timing and location, location, location.  In other words, he’s riding a wave of surging interest in a particular part of Belize.  Very interesting!  So we turn on the microphones and ask him to tell us all about it.  Next thing we know, all kinds of real estate brilliance is falling out of his mouth!  Now we know why he’s so successful. 
So grab your notepad and listen in as we discover how to catch a wave of opportunity and reap tropical profits in paradise! 
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Seven Decades of Real Estate Investing - Perspectives from the Godfather
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Consider how much you've learned in just the past 10 years from the books you've read, people you've met and experiences you've had.  Then imagine talking to someone who's been investing since 1957.  Do you think you could learn at least one important thing from that guy?  We think so, which is why we decided to interview our very own Godfather of Real Estate, Bob Helms.  Listen in and follow Bob's transformation from accidental to intentional investor.  He shares the lessons he learned along the way, and what he would do better if he could start all over.  So if you're less than 75 years old, there are probably some valuable lessons for you in this episode.  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed. Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: The Hidden Beauty of Blue Chip Real Estate Investing
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Nothing's more alluring to a couple of real estate guys than a low cut price and nice perky rents.  But is there more to consider when choosing a property for a long term relationship?   Our guest on today’s episode thinks so.  Ryan Hinricher is a big brained former bank analyst turned real estate investor.  He says before getting too enamored of pro forma potential cash flow, it's wise to look at other figures.  Sounds interesting!  Listen in and as we reveal the hidden beauty of blue chip real estate!  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Transformation in Action - The Tenth Annual Investor Summit at Sea
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: It’s been said that for someone’s circumstances to improve, that someone needs to improve.  Most of us know that. Just like attaining the ideal body weight, we all know what to do. So why aren't we all there?  Because contrary to popular myth, knowledge alone isn’t necessarily power. Some would argue that discipline is the answer.  Perhaps.  But who has the discipline to continually fight against their natural inclinations?  So the secret is to transform one's self into a person who consistently converts knowledge into effective action.  But how?    Transformation turned out to be the impromptu theme of our 2012 Investor Summit.  The knowledge provided by our amazing faculty, including Robert & Kim Kiyosaki, G. Edward Griffin, Rich Dad Advisors Ken McElroy, Garrett Sutton, Tom Wheelwright, Andy Tanner and many other amazing teachers, provided the seeds of change.  But the magic was the environment created through the synergies of investors from all over the world as we learned, laughed and transformed together.  In this episode of The Real Estate Guys radio show, recorded in front of a live studio audience aboard the ship on the final day at sea, our faculty shares their reflections and most important takeaways from arguably the most powerful Summit we’ve ever had.  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.comcceed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Choosing the Right Market - an Engineer's Perspective
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Is there a scientific way to approach market selection?  Something the average real estate investor can actually do?  Our in-studio guest Tom Wilson thinks so! Tom enjoyed a 30 year enginerring and management career in Silicon Valley, but decided that Corporate America wasn't going to provide the kind of financial future he dreamed of.  Real estate looked good, but he'd heard some horror stories, so he decided to put his engineering background to work on designing a secure path to real estate riches.  Today he's done multi-millions of dollars in deals and owns over 230 rental units.  So while he's not Donald Trump or Ken McElroy, his formula seems to be working.  And he says a big part of his success has been thoughful market selection.  Want to know how he did it?  Then listen and learn as Tom Wilson gives us an engineer's perspective on real estate market selection. The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed. Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Nobody's Fool - A Conversation with Donald Trump
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Donald Trump joins The Real Estate Guys™ for a candid conversation about real estate, opportunity, entrepreneurism and the U.S. economy. The Donald says, “If you’re going to think, you might as well think big!”  And since how you think affects what you do, and what do affects the results you produce, it stands to reason that to improve your results, you need to improve your thinking.  So tune in and hear what Donald Trump is thinking about right now - and how you can up your game by picking your pack strategically.  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Finding a Golden Real Estate Agent and Developing Your Midas Touch
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: The right real estate agents are worth their weight in gold.  But how do you find them?  And how do you work effectively with them?  Great questions!  In this enlightening episode, Robert and the Godfather reflect back on their decades of experience as both agents and investors.  Along the way, we take a call from our good friend Robert Kiyosaki, who shares the vision behind the Midas Touch, a new book he’s written with Donald Trump (a pretty successful real estate guy).  Plus Mr. K tells us about the National Achievers Congress, where he, the Donald and Tony Robbins will all be speaking live.  And while the job market may be soft, the opportunities for investors and entrepreneurs are very exciting!  The keys are knowledge and networking.  So dig in and discover nuggets of golden wisdom, then get out to a live event and get connected! The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Zero to Zillions - It All Begins in the Mind
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: How to get started with nothing is one of the most common questions we're asked.  Often, the people asking don't realize how limiting their paradigm is. Everyone has something to work with and most have a lot more than they realize.  Why don't they see it?  We think it starts with the right mindset.  Donald Trump says "Think like a billionaire".  Tony Robbins says "You don't lack resources, you lack resourcefulness."  We think learning cool real estate techniques like lease options, assignable contracts, concurrent closes etc. won't help if you don't have a courageous heart, a creative mind and a powerful compelling why.  Conversely, armed with those things, the real estate entrepreneur will find all the resources and opportunities they can handle - and a lot more!  The challenge becomes how to say no to the good, so you can say yes to the great.  So start by saying YES to this exhilarating episode of The Real Estate Guys™ radio show!  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Being There - What to Look for When Exploring New Real Estate Markets
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Investing where the numbers make sense often means leaving your home town and scoping out new real estate markets.  It’s something we do often and have learned to enjoy.  Hot off an exciting exploratory trip to one market and a fun field trip to another, we thought we’d reflect on the what, why and how of visiting new markets.  And while internet search has made all kinds of data remotely available to the average investor, there’s still no substitute for being there.  So be here with us now and listen in as we discuss what we look for when we go on a real estate market safari! The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com! ©2012 The Real Estate Guys - All rights reserved.

episodes.title: Keeping What You Have - Asset Protection Strategies for Real Estate Investors
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Attorney Garrett Sutton updates us on the latest and greatest in the world of asset protection.  Protecting wealth isn’t as sexy as accumulating it, but it’s still a very important part of being a successful investor.  And as laws change, court cases get decided and revenue hungry states raise fees, it’s vital for astute investors to stay up to date.  So listen in to the conversation, as attorney Garrett Sutton explains how to cover your assets in a very litigious business.  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.title: Fast, Flexible Financing - The Power of Private Lending
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
When banks are broken, borrowers are frustrated.  But this provides a great opportunity for private parties to provide capital to keep things moving.  Best of all, it's profitable for both parties!In this scintillating episode of The Real Estate Guys™ Radio Show, we visit with two real world real estate veterans who are putting private lenders together with out-of-the box borrowers in a market with cash flows that will support it.Find out what they're doing and why...and discover the private lending advantages for both borrower and lender!
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter at www.realestateguysradio.com ©2012 The Real Estate Guys- All rights reserved.Connect with The Real Estate Guys™ on Facebook.com/TheRealEstateGuys

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Lessons Real Estate Investors Can Learn from the Stock Market
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Special guest Andy Tanner is a stock trader who says principles of paper asset trading can be useful to real estate investors.  Really?  Since we’re not fans of the stock market, we thought this was worth checking out.  So we jumped on a plane to Salt Lake City and sat down with Andy face to face.  We found out we have a lot more in common that we thought!  So listen in to the conversation and grab some pearls of paper asset wisdom you can apply to your own real estate investing!  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter!  Visit www.realestateguysradio.com ©2012 The Real Estate Guys  - All rights reserved.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Getting Deals Done - Negotiating Skills Every Investor Needs
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Robert Kiyosaki says the single most important skill every entrepreneur must have is the ability to sell.  We agree!
When it comes to real estate deal making, the more creative you want to be, the less you can reply upon third parties to put your deals together for you.
In this episode, The Real Estate Guys™ draw upon their collective decades of real world experience to share practical tips on developing your powers of persuasion.
Whether you're pitching your project to a banker or investor, trying to get a seller to take YOUR offer instead of the other guy's, or building alliances to help you find, finance and manage deals, this is one episode you don't want to miss!
So grab your notepad and settle in for a powerful session on the fine art of persuasive problem solving and deal making.
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! Visit www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Ask The Guys - Super Bowl Edition
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: It's true.  Super Bowl Sunday is a bigger media event than The Real Estate Guys radio show (hard to believe, we know).  In fact, the Super Bowl's 110 million viewers make it the top viewed show of the year - 5 times bigger than American Idol!  Why should you care?  You shouldn't.  Because unless you're connected to the business of football or lucky enough to place a winning bet, the outcome of the Super Bowl won't affect your financial position at all.  So, for all The Real Estate Guys™ faithful out there, we're in the studio for another exciting edition of Ask The Guys.  We dug into the email grab bag and pulled out a handful of questions to pontificate about while the rest of wolrd watches the Giants and Patriots duke it out.  So tune into The Real Estate Guys™ and fill your brain with real estate investing knowledge -then go out into the real world and make some equity happen!  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  Learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter! Visit www.realestateguysradio.com  ©2012 The Real Estate Guys™ - All rights reserved.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Where in the World to Invest?  Tracking Trends in Global Real Estate
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Emerging economies, free(er) trade, high speed communications and the troubled financial systems of the U.S. and Europe all mean people, money and opportunities are moving around the globe in unprecedented fashion.It’s a lot to keep up on!  But have no fear, The Real Estate Guys are here!In this episode, we take a look at a variety of articles and talk about the trends in global real estate markets.  But even if you aren’t into international investing, it’s important to understand how people around the world think about YOUR real estate market.  For example, many of the buyers helping resurrect the South Florida real estate market are foreigners.  Ditto for Phoenix. So, tune in as The Real Estate Guys talk about tracking the trends in global real estate.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com©2012 The Real Estate Guys - All Rights Reserved

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Getting to the Next Level - Are You Ready for a Coach?
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Elite achievers in every profession use coaches to provide training, accountability, motivation and encouragement.  But what about real estate investors?  And what exactly does a coach do? We were curious, so we headed out to sunny (but freezing) Salt Lake City, Utah to pay a visit on Robert Kiyosaki's Rich Dad Coaching.  Once inside the the safe and warm confines of the Rich Dad Coaching offices, we thawed out our microphones and sat down to interview Eric Lloyd, the Director of Rich Dad Coaching.We were already sold on the importance of coaching, but Eric helps us understand what a coach does, how to pick a good one, what to expect when being coached and how to work effectively with a coach once you have one.Whether you have a coach, want a coach, aren't ready or aren't sure, this episode will help give you important perspectives on what it is to have a real estate investing coach.  Game on!
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.title: Show Me The Money - Financing Outlook for 2012
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Special guest Rob Bonahoom calls in to give us the latest and greatest from the brave new world of real estate financing.  A lot has changed over the last few years, so even though rates are low, what does it take to qualify?  Where is the most and best money available for investors?  Residential? Commercial? Apartments? Inquiring minds want to know!  Tune in and find out!  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.title: Looking Ahead to 2012
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Change is the only constant.  So it's important to monitor the winds of change, and adjust your sails accordingly. What should real estate investors be watching and doing in the New Year?  Join Robert Helms and Russell Gray as they ponder this question heading into 2012.  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Ask The Guys - From Bangalore to Botswana
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Answers to your questions with Robert , Russ and The Godfather!  This episode features a collection of questions that are all over map.  No, really.  We mean these questions come from ALL over the map.  The Real Estate Guys podcast has grown to where it's being downloaded in over 150 countries.  But what’s interesting is that no matter where you are, as long as you have the right to own private property, there is an opportunity to make money with real estate.  And, even though some of the technical details change from location to location, the basic principles of investing remain remarkably the same.  So tune in for some international Q&A that you can apply to your own local investing - no matter where you are!  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Regional Roundup - Taking The Pulse of the U.S. Real Estate Market
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Hear updates on 8 real estate markets by 8 real estate practitioners in The Real Estate Guys™ version of market speed dating!  After all, before you go out on a field trip date or get into heavy investing, why not get a quick sampling of what's out there?  And as great as the internet is, sometimes you just need the warmth of a real human voice.Sharing their perspectives on how their respective markets fared in 2011 and what they see on the horizon in 2012, we talk with people active in the Memphis, Miami, Atlanta, San Jose, Dallas, Minneapolis, Phoenix and Washington DC real estate markets.  And we learn some things that really suprise us!  Do people really pay cash for million dollar properties?  They do!  Find out where when you listen in for a fast paced survey on the mood of the market in U.S. real estate.  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Back to the Future – Embracing the Changes in Real Estate Investing
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Changes in technology, the economy, laws, banking, politics and even pop culture all affect the flow of people and money to and from geographic areas, price points and product types.  Whew! That’s a lot to think about!  The good news is that when change happens, so does opportunity - but we need to be paying attention.  In this episode, Robert, Russ and the Godfather talk about how real estate reacts to changes in external conditions and why it’s important to recognize and invest with the trends.  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Infinite Banking - The Broken Banking System and What You Can Do About It
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Today’s banking system is a far cry from George Bailey’s Bailey Building and Loan in the classic film It’s a Wonderful Life.  Back then, savers put money in local institutions where local bankers lent it out to local borrowers.  Today everything funnels through Wall Street and the Federal Reserve, and the last few years have shown that when deals get too far away from Main Street, weird stuff happens.  But do you have a choice?  The Real Estate Guys’ special guests, authors Robert Murphy and Carlos Lara say you do!  Listen in to the conversation and discover how you can circumvent the big banks and put your savings to work much closer to home.  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: The Real World of Credit - Improve Your Credit Score Fast
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Credit repair expert Wayne Sanford updates us on the real world of credit and what you can do to improve your credit score fast.  In today’s tight credit markets, a better credit score is not just a matter of getting a better interest rate - it can be the difference between getting approved or being rejected.  And since we hate rejection, we think it’s a good idea to get some qualified credit score help so we can take advantage of all the wonderfully low interest rates available in today’s mortgage markets!  Listen in and learn what’s happening in today’s credit game and what you can do to improve your credit score…before you apply for that next big loan!  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.title: Ask The Guys - Values, Ventures, Volatility and Velocity
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Answering your questions is one of our favorite things to do!  Every few weeks, we reach into the email grab bag and pull out a handful of interesting questions from our worldwide audience. Join hosts Robert Helms, Russell Gray and The Godfather of Real Estate, Bob Helms, for this episode of Ask The Guys as we discuss values, ventures, volatility and velocity - and whatever else our very vociferous brain trust decides to comment on. The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: The Compound Effect and Success Strategies for a Down Economy
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Success Magazine publisher Darren Hardy is our special guest for this inspiring episode of The Real Estate Guys™ radio show!  We’re guessing if you’re interested in real estate investing, you plan on being successful.  And if you believe principles of success in any endeavor can be learned and implemented, then you’re going to LOVE this show.  Darren not only enjoys the amazing privilege of interviewing some of the most successful people from all over the world and all walks of life, but he is also an incredibly accomplished person himself.  We visit with him in the offices of Brian Tracy (another successful man and mentor to millions) and collect several precious pearls of wisdom, including why your adversity is your advantage. Plus, we get the inside scoop on Darren's brand new book, The Compound Effect. So open your brain wide and get ready to fill it up with great ideas from a man who both studies and models success at the highest levels.  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Multi-Family Market Musings plus a Different Look at the Rat Race
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Who in their right mind would buy over $300 million of real estate in the middle of a giant recession? And if that isn’t crazy enough, who would think that people actually need and love the rat race? In this eclectic episode, host Robert Helms talks with two guys who both look at the world a little differently than the average Joe.  Ken McElroy is Rich Dad Poor Dad author Robert Kiyosaki’s long time real estate advisor (and returning for his third year as a faculty member on The Real Estate Guys Annual Summit at Sea!).  Ken started buying up apartment buildings as the Great Recession was wreaking havoc on the economy. Why would he do that?  Listen in and find out!  Then stay tuned as Robert chats with Todd Buchholz about his new book “Rush - Why You Need and LOVE the Rat Race”.  Todd is a former White House director of economic policy who says we don’t really want to relax…we want to compete!  So if you’re a frustrated type “A” who dreams of being a quiet “B”, listen to Todd explain why busy is better.  Then take a look at all the problems in the real estate market that need to be solved.  There’s plenty of opportunity to keep you very busy! The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Halloween Horror Stories - Terrifying Tales of Troubles and Lessons Learned
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Pain is life’s way of getting your attention when it wants to teach you something.  Real estate investors buy properties because they want rent checks, but every once in awhile you’ll get a reality check instead.  And that’s what Halloween Horror Stories is all about!  In this eerie episode, we look at random samplings of scary stuff that happens to real life real estate investors.  We discuss the problem, the solution and most importantly, the lesson.  The good news is that someone else (not you!) paid full price for the lesson, but you get to learn it simply for being brave enough to listen!  So grab your bag of trick or treat candy and settle in for some terrifying tales of trials and tribulations faced by intrepid real estate investors! The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: The Creature from Jekyll Island - A Conversation with G. Edward Griffin
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: The Federal Reserve Bank is arguably the most powerful non-governmental institution on the planet.  It controls the money supply of the world’s largest economy, has a profound impact on interest rates and inflation (both of which directly affect real estate investors!), and has tremendous authority over all banking in the United States.  And if all that wasn’t power enough, because the U.S. dollar serves as the reserve currency of the world, the Fed and its policies also profundly affect global trade.  It's no wonder then, as the 2012 elections approach, with so much emphasis on the economy, that the topic of the Federal Reserve has made its way into the mainstream of the presidential debates.  Ron Paul wants to end it.  Rick Perry says its acts are treasonous.  Herman Cain was a Chairman of the Kansas City Fed.  Yet, many people really don’t know who the Fed is, what it does, how it works, or who it’s accountable to.  One thing is for sure: The Fed is controversial.  Fortunately, we aren't afraid of a little controversy. It makes life interesting!  So, we decided it would be fun to stir the pot a little bit by tracking down the author of one of the most iconic, well-researched and controversial books we know of on the topic of the Fed.  Whether you love it, hate it, or it's an enigma to you, if you’re a serious real estate investor, you need to understand the Fed.  Listen in as we talk to documentary filmmaker, author and activist, G. Edward Griffin about his controversial research and perspectives on the Fed.  Then, continue your education by visiting the Recommended Reading area of our website for additional books and other opinions about this powerful and controversial institution. The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Teach Your Children Well - The Rules of Money Have Changed
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Robert Kiyosaki shares his thoughts about the new economic reality facing young people.  His Rich Dad Poor Dad message of financial education, entrepreneurism and alternative investing has resonated with many millions of people all around the globe.  Kiyosaki notes that rapid changes from banking to technology to international trade continue to create a variety of challenges - and opportunities - for everyone - especially younger people.  So what do young people need to be thinking about to be prepared? How can older folks help the next generation (and themselves) to profit in a rapidly changing economy?  Whether you're a parent, young yourself, or simply young at heart, listen in as Robert Kiyosaki draws from his extensive world travels and life experiences to share why the rules of money have changed and how you can (and should!) prosper anyway!  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Market Spotlight - Exploring Atlanta, Georgia
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
Atlanta, Georgia is one of the largest metros in the United States.  Strategically located in the southeast, Atlanta is a hub for transportation.  And with a strong education infrastructure, a favorable climate and low cost of living, Atlanta boasts a large, young, well-educated population, and is home to several Fortune 500 companies.  In fact, Atlanta is one of the fastest growing areas over the last ten years. There's a lot to like about Atlanta!
But does all that add up to good investment potential - and do the numbers make sense?
To find out, The Real Estate Guys™ sit down with two experts and focus the market spotlight on Atlanta, Georgia.
Join hosts Robert Helms and Russell Gray, along with regular contributor, The Godfather of Real Estate, Bob Helms; and special in-studio guests (all the way from Atlanta, Georgia!) Ken Corsini and Bruce Carlisle.
The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Zero Tax! Deductions and Benefits that Matter Most to Real Estate Investors
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: CPA Tom Wheelwright says, "Active real estate investors should NEVER pay tax on their cash flow or gains...EVER!"  Sounds good to us!  But how?  Find out in this episode when we sit down to talk taxes with this Rich Dad Advisor to Robert Kiyosaki.  Plus, Tom reveals the most common mistake he sees on real estate investors' tax returns and why the tax code is both a tool and a treasure map to real estate riches.  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Finding the Right Market with the Right Jobs
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Picking markets with the right kind of jobs is the subject of this intriguing episode of The Real Estate Guys™ radio show.  After all, tenants have an easier time paying the rent if they actually have a job!  To learn more, we visit with the CEO of one city’s Chamber of Commerce.  Tune in and discover what this city is doing to attract businesses and grow jobs, and some things you should be looking for when you’re scouting out real estate markets for long term investment - especially in a fragile economy. The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Retirement Planning Abroad and Beyond -  Have Your Cake and Eat It Too
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: When it comes to retirement, getting there means knowing where, why and how.  And without foresight, opportunities can be squandered or missed altogether.  Since real estate is simply a means to an end, it's important to begin with the end in mind.In this episode, Host Robert Helms takes a look at some things to think about when planning your retirement approach.  Then he sits down with two special guests to get updated on two diverse topics, though both are related to retirement planning.First, Phil Hardcastle brings us up to speed on Mexico.  As U.S. baby boomers look for warm, affordable places to retire near the U.S., is Mexico still a hot destination?  Phil is a real estate developer and broker, originally from Southlake, Texas and now based in San Miguel de Allende, Mexico.  A first time guest, we've known Phil for years.  And with all the hoopla about Mexico, we wanted to get the straight scoop.Next, Jeffrey Verdon returns to The Real Estate Guys Radio Show to update us on the latest and greatest tool in estate planning - something he says allows you to have your cake and eat it too.  Sounds interesting!The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: A Tale of Two Investors - Building a Business and Leaving a Legacy
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary: Learning real estate investing is a lot more than just understanding contracts, financing and lease agreements.  Technical knowledge is important, but easily obtained, while "soft skills" (attitudes, habits and beliefs), inner drive, and the right team of advisors, vendors, staff and friends are arguably even more important, yet much more elusive.  As your intrepid hosts, we trot around the globe (mostly the Western Hemisphere), talking to the smartest, most experienced people we can find.  And fortunately for you, we take our microphones along so we can bring all this fabulous knowledge back to you!  In this episode, we talk to two different real world real estate investors from two different markets.  Listen in as we sit down with in Memphis with real estate entrepreneur Terry Kerr, and then during the commercial break, jet out to Las Vegas where we connect with our faithful Oregon based buy and hold listener, Craig Horton.  Learn how they got started, what they're doing today and some of the most important lessons they learned along the way.  The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
episodes.title: Reaping Profits from Resource Backed Investments
episodes.author: info@realestateguysradio.com (The Real Estate Guys)
episodes.summary:
When the quality of the currency is questionable, it's critical to be extra careful when selecting markets and property types.That sounds good, but what does it mean in the real world?The answer isn't short, but it's very common sense once you hear it.  And we get the lessons from some unlikely guests.
First we visit with Frank Trotter, President of Everbank Direct. As a banker who deals not only in dollars, but in a variety of currencies, he has a unique perspective on how resources such as oil affect the stability of currencies.  And yes, there is a very important lesson in there for real estate investors.
Our next guest is Mark Bragg of Shadowrock Farms.  Mark draws attention to food as one of the most important resources of all.  And once again, there is a very interesting real estate play involved.
We're betting you haven't heard anything like this anywhere else!So listen in as The Real Estate Guys™ research the strategic role of resources in picking markets, properties and currencies to protect and grow your wealth.The Real Estate Guys™ radio show provides real estate investing news, education, training and resources to help real estate investors succeed.  To learn more and subscribe to the free newsletter, visit www.realestateguysradio.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The Real Estate Guys Radio Show - Real Estate Investing Education for Effective Action
